<math alttext="H C 2 H O 3 aqueous plus H 2 O liquid is in equilibrium with H 3 O with a positive 1 charge aqueous plus C 2 H O 3 with a negative 1 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>HO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>⇄</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>) </mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>p</mtext><msub> <mi>K</mi> <mi>a</mi> </msub> <mo>=</mo><mn>3.18</mn><mtext> at 25</mtext><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahqart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGWbGaam4sam aaBaaaleaacaWGHbaabeaakiabg2da9iaaiodacaGGUaGaaGymaiaa iIdacaqGGaGaaeyyaiaabshacaqGGaGaaeOmaiaabwdacqGHWcaSca qGdbaaaa@470B@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>

The equilibrium for the acid ionization of <math alttext="H C 2 H O 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>HO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is represented by the equation above. If <math alttext="10.0 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="0.20 molar H C 2 H O 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>HC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>HO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> react with <math alttext="5.0 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="0.10 molar N a O H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NaOH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following could be used to calculate the correct <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the resulting solution?

choices.label: <math alttext="p H equals p K sub a plus the log of the fraction 0.10 over 0.20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>p</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mtext>log</mtext><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.20</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="p H equals p K sub a plus the log of the fraction 0.0050 times 0.10, over 0.0100 times 0.20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>p</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mtext>log</mtext><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.0050</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>0.10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.0100</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>0.20</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="p H equals p K sub a plus the log of open bracket, open parenthesis, the fraction 0.0050 times 0.10, over 0.0150, end fraction, close parenthesis, divided by the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 0.0100 times 0.20, close parenthesis, minus open parenthesis, 0.0050 times 0.10 close parenthesis, and denominator, 0.0150, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>p</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mtext>log</mtext><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.0050</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>0.10</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0.0150</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mo>/</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.0100</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>0.20</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.0050</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>0.10</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0.0150</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="p H equals p K sub a plus the log of open bracket, the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 0.0050 times 0.10, close parenthesis, plus open parenthesis, 0.0100 times 0.20, close parenthesis, and denominator, 0.0150, end fraction, divided by the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 0.0100 times 0.20, close parenthesis, minus open parenthesis, 0.0050 times 0.10 close parenthesis, and denominator, 0.0150, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>p</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mtext>log</mtext><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.0050</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>0.10</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.0100</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>0.20</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0.0150</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mo>/</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.0100</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>0.20</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.0050</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>0.10</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0.0150</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="p H equals p K sub a plus the log of open bracket, open parenthesis, the fraction 0.0050 times 0.10, over 0.0150, end fraction, close parenthesis, divided by the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 0.0100 times 0.20, close parenthesis, minus open parenthesis, 0.0050 times 0.10 close parenthesis, and denominator, 0.0150, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>p</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mtext>log</mtext><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.0050</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>0.10</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0.0150</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mo>/</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.0100</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>0.20</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.0050</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>0.10</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0.0150</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
